paragraphs.text: The reason the Democrats were this careless and abusive with the national security apparatus is because they were dead certain Hillary was going to win the election. They were sure there would be no answering for their abuses of power, because that would only happen if Trump won, which was impossible. They figured it would be Hillary people taking over the national security apparatus — and like they’re going to investigate the Obama intelligence community abusing its power to spy on Hillary’s opponent in the election.
paragraphs.name: 916a

paragraphs.text: Ordinarily, such references to Americans would be redacted or minimized by the NSA before being shared with outside intelligence sources, but in these cases, names were sometimes unmasked at the request of Rice or the intelligence reports were specific enough that the American’s identity was easily ascertained, the sources said.

The intelligence reports included some intercepts of Americans talking to foreigners and many more involving foreign leaders talking about the future president, his campaign associates or his transition, the sources said. Most if not all had nothing to do with the Russian election interference scandal, the sources said, speaking only on condition of anonymity given the sensitive nature of the materials.
paragraphs.name: f074

paragraphs.text: Democrats would consider this the biggest scandal in US history if it were a Republican administration doing it to a Democratic nominee. This is the question for leftists arguing Susan Rice did nothing wrong, and in fact was doing a good thing: Does Trump have your permission to do the same thing to the 2020 Democratic nominee? Didn’t think so.
paragraphs.name: 80d1

paragraphs.text: There was no foreign intelligence value to the reports. But they certainly may have had domestic political value for the Democratic Party.

The monitoring may have been “incidental,” but it was deliberate. The unmasking of the names is the proof: if the monitoring of the Trump people truly was “incidental,” then there’s no reason their names should’ve been unmasked. If they were only surveilled by accident, then why were their names relevant? The very fact that the names were unmasked belies the bogus claim that the Trump people were merely “swept up” in the surveillance — just collateral damage! Whoops. It was the foreign persons who were “incidentally” monitored. The Trump people were the real targets.
paragraphs.name: 71ac

paragraphs.text: Devin Nunes, the Republican House Intelligence Committee Chairman, has said that it’s not so much the “incidental” monitoring of the Trump people that’s the problem (given that there’s no way to prove the Trump people weren’t the targets), but rather the widespread unmasking, i.e. revealing the identities of the Trump people despite them not being the stated targets of the surveillance. That’s what he was most concerned about.
paragraphs.name: a251
